docs.text: director david fincher has such an eye for detail which is very rare in hollywood these days ( terry gilliam comes to mind as another one ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: film is one of the best art forms because not only can you tell a story , but you can use the camera to capture the smallest detail and have it mean something .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but most directors seem to go for action with the slightest ounce of a story .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so whenever a director uses the camera to its fullest potential , the film almost automatically deserves a good review .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and when they add a fascinating story to it , you have nearly perfect entertainment .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: fincher's the game is no exception to this .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the game is one of the most interesting and complex films to come out of hollywood in a long time .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: fincher hasn't made a film since " seven , " his box office and critical hit which defied expectations and became one of the best movies ever .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so it is about time he made another film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and what a ride it is .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the game isn't quite as powerful as " seven , " but in some ways it is better .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: overall , the game could have used a little more clarity , or a little more uncertainty .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it walks a line of insanity and reality , but it never goes either way until the very end .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the outcome is satisfying enough for the preceding events , and it makes a lot of sense once everything is set straight .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unfortunately , unlike " the usual suspects , " we are never given enough information to figure out for ourselves what is happening , whether it be true or false .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , this also gives the film a frightening aspect which the game uses to the fullest extent .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the game is told completely from its main character's point of view .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: nicholas van orton ( michael douglas ) is a high-strung and isolated businessman .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he lives alone in his giant mansion , divorced from his wife elizabeth , and is celebrating his 48th birthday ; the same age at which his father committed suicide at , in the same mansion .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: for his 48th birthday , conrad ( sean penn ) , the rebel of the family , gives nicholas a gift certificate to crs : consumer recreation services .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " it will make your life fun again , " his brother promises .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as skeptical as nicholas is , he is somewhat intrigued , and annoyed by the lack of information--something this businessman hates .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: seeing a billboard in an office , he decides to visit the mysterious company .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: jim feingold ( james rebhorn ) greets nicholas and guides him through the sign-up process , which consists of psych-tests , physicals , emotional responses , and other mind games .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " each game is suited to each person's emotional and psychological needs , " explains feingold .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one day , nicholas gets a call from crs and they explain that he failed the tests .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even more intrigued and now somewhat angered at the time he spent signing up , he starts asking around to see what people can tell him about the company .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what he doesn't realize is that the game has already begun .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the phone call is just the first of many strange events to be thrown nicholas' way .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: how he finds out that he is involved has to be witnessed because it is amusing and fun and visually impressive .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the detail involved in fincher's shots is incredible and almost requires a second viewing just to appreciate the effort that went into them .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: with " seven , " fincher had almost every single shot mean something .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he also has the unique ability to make you look at exactly what he wants you to .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: compared to " seven , " though , the game is light and comical .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: because of this film's sense of humor and self-awareness , nothing can be taken quite seriously .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so don't try to make much sense of what goes on in the game , because it doesn't want you to .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what does make sense is the final revelation--when everything becomes apparent and clear .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if taken as it is , the game's ending makes complete sense .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but if you try and critique every minute detail , then you get yourself into plot holes and incredibility .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: perhaps that is the reason i docked the film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while trying to remain realistic and plausible , the plot is too unbelievable to create any real tension on screen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we don't really care if douglas' character lives or not because it isn't believable .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the ending requires you to have believed anything that has happened previously , but if you suspend disbelief and take the film as it is , you can accept the game as an emotionally and psycholically disturbing thriller .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: michael douglas gives a terrific performance as nicholas .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: douglas has played lonely businessmen before , but here he adds another level to his performance .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his character , who is normally level-headed and relies on facts , is forced to trust nobody .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: can he believe the waitress he bumped into ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what about his brother who got him involved in the game in the first place ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: douglas portrays this aspect of his character extremely well , and gives one of his best performances ( even better than his " falling down " persona ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the supporting cast is essential in this film , and casting was critical .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sean penn is always good , and he gives yet another credible performance as douglas' brother .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: deborah kara unger ( from " crash " ) is the waitress he bumps into , and her performance is extremely good .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in fact , she almost steals the film from douglas .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: james rebhorn portrays his character very well , and adds some confusion and desparation to douglas' predicament .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: another good performance comes from armin mueller-stahl ( from " shine " ) as the book editor .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but considering that douglas is in every single scene of the game , he not only commands this cast , but makes this distant and lonely character come to colorful life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the game is rated r for language , violence , some gore , and some nudity and drugs .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what is essential for this film to work is the writing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: john brancato and michael ferris have woven a confusing and compelling screenplay with witty dialogue , and some very funny moments .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this screenplay will probably get an oscar nomination for best original screenplay because it does almost exactly the same thing the usual suspects' did .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , the visuals of the game are enough to make the viewer enjoy the vexing plot .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and if you can get yourself to believe everything occuring on the screen , you will be thoroughly entertained by one of this year's best films .
docs.label: positive
